| <tablestyle="width:100%;" style="width: 40px; border: none; -moz-border-radius-topleft: 15px ;-moz-border-radius-bottomleft: 15px; background-color: #D9D9F3; border: none; -moz-border-radius-topright: 15px;-moz-border-radius-bottomright: 15px; font-size: 1.50em; text-align: center;"><nowiki>[[File:NClogo3wikiheader.jpg | width=75|height=50]]</nowiki> '''Welcome to the NC Ubuntu Lo``Co Team Approval Application'''<nowiki>[[File:NClogo3wikiheader.jpg | width=75|height=50]]</nowiki>
|}

The North Carolina Local Community (Lo``Co) Team began to organize itself in July of 2007 with attempts to identify others who were interested in Linux and Ubuntu.  From that start the team continues to grow as more efforts to expose the diverse population of North Carolina increase each week.  Because of the independence and separation caused by the three distinct geographical regions of North Carolina, that task is daunting.  However, the team, with its determination to be inclusive and open, has bridged the geographic and societal gaps such that we can now celebrate state-wide participation from the western, mountainous section of the state to the beaches of the Atlantic sea coast.  Several major cities in North Carolina now have Linux user groups that are supported by the Lo``co Team and active Lo``co Team members reside in all parts of North Carolina.  The Team, from its earliest organizational efforts, has, and continues to be, very active.

The NC Lo``Co Team is a group of Ubuntu-Linux enthusiasts whose common goal is to share Ubuntu and its derivatives with all areas of the Tar Heel state. In accordance with the Ubuntu philosophy, this team is '''open and available to all'''. Our members range from non-technical end user (NTEU) to Ubuntu-Linux Kernel developers.

The team assists many North Carolinians through various individual and team initiatives to expose the Tar Heel State to Ubuntu, but the efforts to join such a diverse population through another commonality is a benefit to the state as a whole.  It is in that spirit that the team is adopting the motto of:

| <style="border:none; color: #43164f; font-size: 1.50em;"> '''__Roadmap__'''
|}

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; color: #ea070e;"> '''Lo``Co Support:'''
|}

  {*} Become more active within Ubuntu US community apply to become listed as mentors for the Lo``Co teams throughout the US.

  {*} Develop a mentorship from the active NC Lo``Co team members and see where we can help each other as well as other Lo``Co Teams.

  {*} Continual usage of Forums, Mailing List and IRC to maintain active community and participation to and from all team Lo``Co as well as Ubuntu Community participants.

  {*} Community Participation - Helping new users of Ubuntu who want to get involved in the Ubuntu project find a path whereby they can achieve both personal goal as well as contribute and participate to the Ubuntu OS.

  {*} Continual Face to Face meet-ups whether through Ubuntu-hours or informal gatherings to continue to build Team morale and cohesiveness.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; color: #ea070e;"> '''Development:'''
|}

  {*} Organize and assist members of the NC Lo``Co team with becoming more involved in Bug Triage, and the Q/A process for development releases.

  {*} NC Lo``Co team members are currently working to help develop the Lo``Co Leadership series and as well as plan for the 1st Ubuntu Lo``Co Leadership Days scheduled to take place in June 2010.

  {*} Encourage other team members to see where than contribute and help with the development of the Ubuntu OS as well as the Community.

  {*} Provide assistance with programming and packaging on and for Ubuntu

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; color: #ea070e;"> '''Local Advocacy:'''
|}

  {*} Develop greater participation in statewide NC Lo``co Team by facilitating regional teams in additional metropolitan areas of North Carolina.

  {*} Develop a program for presentation throughout North Carolina to LUGs, schools, and other venues promoting the NC Lo``Co Team and the Ubuntu Community.

  {*} Attend more expos and shows to hand out even more CDs, flyers, posters, and other swag while demonstrating Ubuntu and Variants to the crowd

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none; color: #ea070e;"> '''Wider FOSS and Ubuntu Community Involvement:'''
|}

  {*} Working with <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SouthCarolinaTeam | South Carolina Lo``Co team]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/GeorgiaUSTeam | Georgia US Lo``Co Team]]</nowiki>, and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/FloridaTeam | Florida Lo``Co Team]]</nowiki> in reference to collaboration on Ubuntu Booths at various Linux Fests in the South East (<nowiki>[[http://www.southeastlinuxfest.org/ |SELF]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://atlantalinuxfest.org/ALF | ALF]]</nowiki>).

  {*} Ubu``Cons and Ubuntu User Conference - Members of the NC Lo``co Team were instrumental in the execution of Atlanta UbuCon at the 2009 Atlanta Linux Fest, SCaLE 8x Ubucon, as well as the upcoming SELF 2010 Ubu``con.  Plans are underway for a 2011 Ubuntu User Conference to be held in Atlanta, GA.

  {*} Ongoing support and facilitation of LUG groups throughout NC: Tri``Lug, WNCLUG, GCLUG.
